results.title: Ponette
results.creator_credit: Jacques Doillon, Alain Sarde and Arrow Productions
results.brief_description: Powerful and touching film portrayal of a four-year-old girl’s struggle to understand the meaning of death after she loses her mother in a car accident in which she herself is also injured. Following her mother’s funeral, Ponette is left by her father in the care of her aunt, where she and her two cousins are largely left to resolve their confusion and loss on their own. Told by her aunt about Jesus’ resurrection, Ponette patiently awaits her mother’s return, a reunion she dreams about incessantly. Related entirely from the perspective of the young girl, the film is dominated by the performance of Victorie Thivisol who won best actress at the 1996 Venice Film Festival for her role. Doillon’s success in entering the mind of a child grappling with the concept of death, stemmed from his writing and auditioning process. He established a workshop for four- and five-year-olds selected during a comprehensive audition process and worked for six months with the children, acting out scenarios and creating sketches, asking their opinions on a variety of subjects and adapting his script from their dialogue. This unique collaboration - giving the children a full range of expression - solidifies the film’s emotional base. In French with English subtitles.

results.title: Ponds: an introduction
results.creator_credit: Donald Walton, Anvil Films and Record Group and Seabourne Enterprises
results.brief_description: Explains the yearly cycle of pond life, the dependence on warmth and light for growth and the interchange of oxygen and carbon dioxide. The pond returns to rest period when days shorten and the water becomes cold and minerals are replenished from decaying plants and animals in readiness for the circle to begin again.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Donald Walton, Anvil Films and Record Group and Seabourne Enterprises

results.title: Pond zero
results.creator_credit: Dietmar Fill, Don Harley and Film Australia
results.brief_description: A microscopic look at life in a salt water pond located in South Australia providing a unique insight with the use of infra-red light and underwater time-lapse cameras.

results.title: Pond insects
results.brief_description: The diving water beetle, the mayfly, and the dragonfly represent this group of insects. Their life cycles are portrayed as well as their food habits and struggle for existence.

results.title: Pond animals
results.brief_description: Demonstrates methods of collecting pond animals, both microscopic and macroscopic, and encourages children to study pond life for themselves. A newt, stickleback and wil-i-gig beetle are caught and then in jars to the laboratory to be examined. Other animals seen are the water scorpion, Great Pond Snail, Water Boatmen, Daphnia and others. A drop of pond water is also studied under the microscope.

results.creator_credit: Kenneth Campbell and International Film Bureau

results.title: Pompeii: once there was a city
results.creator_credit: Sol Kaplan, Reva Schlesinger and RSK Productions
results.brief_description: Explores the ruins of the ancient city of Pompeii which was buried by volcanic lava in 79 AD. Recreates the everyday lives of its citizens, interspersed with shots of modern day living to suggest contemporary parallels. Suitable for lower and middle secondary levels.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Sol Kaplan, Reva Schlesinger and RSK Productions

results.title: Pompeii and Vesuvius
results.brief_description: Shows an actual eruption of Mt Vesuvius and against this background recalls the destruction of the city of Pompeii in 79 AD. The film depicts present-day life in the ruined city of Pompeii and life in the cities and villages around Naples, including folk dancing in Sorrento.

results.title: Polyurethane progress
results.brief_description: A technical film dealing with research, manufacturing processes and the development of outlets for the rigid and flexible foam plastic industry. Illustrates the advanced scientific methods of production, including the moulding of foam car seats by micro-wave units, and the application of rigid foam to wall and other surfaces for insulation purposes.
